msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.title: Genesis 44
ab.l: Andhe commanded the man who was the superior over his house, saying,‘Fill the men’s sacks with grain,as much as they can carry, and put every man’s silverin his sack’s mouth.
And my cup: put the cup,in the sack’s mouth of the younger, and the silverfor his grain.’ And he did according to the word that Josephhad spoken.
The morning was light, and the menwere sent away, they and their donkeys.

Theyhad gone out of the city. They had not gone far, and Joseph saidto the man who was the superior over his house, ‘Arise. Followafter the men, and reach them, and say to them, “Whydid you pay back bad for good?
Lo, this is itfrom which my lord drinks. And he divines by it!You have done eveil in doing this.”’
And he reached them,and he spoke to them these same words.
And they said to him, ‘Why speaks my lord words like these? Far be itfrom your servants to do a thing like this.
Lo,we brought the silver which we found in our sacks’ mouths back to youfrom the land of Canaan, so how would we stealsilver or gold from your lord’s house?
The one fromyour servants with whom it is found, let him die, and also we will become my lord’s servants.’
And he said, ‘Now, also, it shall be according to your words:he with whom it is found shallbe my servant. And you will be free.’
Andthey hurried and every man took down his sack to the ground, and every man openedhis sack.
And he searched. He began at the oldest,and ended at the young. And the cup was found in Benjamin’s sack.
And they tore their clothes, and loaded everyman his donkey, and returned to the city.

And Judah and his brothers came to Joseph’s house, andhe was still there, and they fell before him on the ground.And Joseph said to them, ‘What is this deedthat you have done? Lo, don’t you know that a man like me would divine?’

And Judah said, ‘What shall we sayto my lord? What shall we speak, and |how| shall we show our righteousness? Godhas found the iniquity of your servants. Lo, we are my lord’s servants,both we and also he in whose hand the cup is found.’
And he said, ‘Far be it from you to do this!The man in whose hand the cup is found, he shall be myservant, and you, you go in |good| health to your father.’Parashat Vayigash
And Judah came near to him,and said, ‘Oh my lord, let your servant, I pray you, speak nowa word in my lord’s ears, and let not your anger burn against your servant,because you are even as Pharaoh.
My lordasked his servants, saying, “Have you a father, or abrother?”
And we said to my lord, “We havea father, and a son with the habits of an old man, a little one, and his brotherdied, and he alone is left of his mother, and his father loved him.”
And you said to your servants, “Bring him down to me,and let me set my eyes on him.”
Andwe said to my lord, “The boy cannot leave his father, andhe will die.”
And you said to your servants, “Ifyour brother comes not down with you, you shall not see my face again.”
And it was, when we went to your servant, my father,that we told him the words of my lord,
Andour father said, “Go back, and buy us a little grain.”
And we said, “We cannot go down: if ouryounger brother goes with us, then we will go down,because we cannot see the man’s face, if ouryounger brother is not with us.”
And your servant, my father, saidto us, “You know that my wife bore two for me,
And one went away from me, and I said,“He is surely torn up, and I have not seen him since.”
And if you take this also from me,and death befall him, you will bring down my greyhair with in wretchedness to the grave.”
And now,as soon as I come to your servant, my father, and the boy is not with me,and his soul is bound to his soul,
And it shall beas soon as he sees that the boy is not, he will die. Andyour servants will bring down the grey hair of your servant, our father,with sorrow to the grave,
Because your servant took the responsibility for theboy from my father, saying, “If I do not bring him to youthen I will sin against my father for all the days.”
Andnow, let your servant abide instead of the boy, a servantto my lord, and let the boy go with his brothers.
Becausehow shall I go to my father, and the boy is not with me? LestI see the evil that will find my father.’

app.note: K: an uncertain translation of uvul qart qylyqly ‘with the habits of old man’; cf. Gen 37:3. | TKow.01: ulan qart qylyqly; the same translation as in K. | H: uvul qart qylyqly; the same translation as in K. | C: qartlyq oɣul ‘son of his old age’.
